definitions.definition: The daily fluctuation in the level of the sea caused by the gravitational influence of the moon and the sun.
examples: The Bristol Channel has some of the world's largest tides .
A lot of driftwood was brought in on the tide .

definitions.definition: Any similar gravitational effect on Earth or other body.
examples: As well as sea tides , there are much smaller land tides .
By far the largest tides on Europa are those caused by the gravitational attraction of Jupiter.

definitions.definition: A high-volume flow, literal or figurative; a current or flood .
examples: The sewer burst, and a tide of sewage poured into nearby properties.
A tide of people crossed over the border.
We've encountered a tide of problems.

definitions.definition: The tendency or direction of causes, influences, or events; course; current.
examples: The tide of public opinion has turned.

definitions.definition: Time, notably anniversary , period or season linked to an ecclesiastical feast.

examples: The doctor's no good this tide .

definitions.definition: A point or period of time identified or described by a qualifier.
examples: Even tide , noon tide , morrow tide , night tide , moon tide , harvest tide , winter tide , summer tide , spring tide , autumn tide etc.

definitions.definition: Something which changes like the tides of the sea .

main_definition: The daily fluctuation in the level of the sea caused by the gravitational influence of the moon and the sun.
secondary_definitions: Any similar gravitational effect on Earth or other body.
A high-volume flow, literal or figurative; a current or flood .
The tendency or direction of causes, influences, or events; course; current.
( chronology , obsolete , except in liturgy ) Time, notably anniversary , period or season linked to an ecclesiastical feast.
( regional , archaic , in compounds ) A point or period of time identified or described by a qualifier.
( mining ) The period of twelve hours.
( Can we verify this sense?) Something which changes like the tides of the sea .
( Can we verify this sense?) ( obsolete ) Violent confluence .
